intro: Strumaria tenella subsp. orientalis, commonly known as the oriental bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia. It features slender, upright stems that bear clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This species is valued in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
